lines.text: I like my job, mum. It's fun, it's interesting and I meet a lot of nice people.
Nonsense. Tourists aren't people. They're... They're tourists.
How could you kiss that girl?
It was easy.
My French blood tells me to argue with you and my Hawain blood tells me not to mind - they're battling it out in front of me.
I've never seen such a beautiful battleground.
You sure kept them both in good shape.
Both?
Hmm hmm. Your body and my car.

[singing]
Baby I was almost always true to you, I was almost true to you.

[Seeing Elvis and Blackman kissing on beach]
Can I play?
I think you're a little young for this game.
If I get a girl can I play with you?
I'd rather drive girls than bananas any day!
You can't spend the rest of your life on a surf board.
Oh yes, I can. The G.I. bill of rights says I get my old job back. This is my old job.
Now that Chadwick's home, I'm sure he's got all that foolishness out of his system, after the war.
Sarah Lee, how many times do I have to tell you, he was not in a war.
I know you're right, Daddy, but if I don't tell myself there was a war, I have a most depressive feeling Chadwick's just wasted two years.
I think you're a mixed-up kid that's too big for her breeches.
I don't wear breeches.
You're getting out of here right now, Miss No-Breeches Bardot!
Chad, do you think I'm pretty?
I think you're pretty forward and pretty stupid.
Wouldn't you rather hold me than Abigail?
I'd like to hold you over a barbecue pit!
You know what you need? A good old-fashioned spanking.
M-Maybe I do. Nobody ever cared enough about me. Even for that.
Alright, Eleanor. I better prove that somebody does care.
[He pulls her over his lap]
You wouldn't dare.
Oh wouldn't I dare? Wouldn't I?
[He spanks her, and Ellie begins to cry out]
I got a feeling that this is gonna make both of us an awful lot better.
You wanna know something - on you, wet is my favourite colour.

[When Chad gives her racy bikini]
I thank you for thinking of me.
Oh I wasn't thinking of you, I was thinking of me.
This is crazy seaweed.
That's no seaweed, that's the top of Maile's bathing suit.
You can't spend the rest of your life on a surfboard.
Yes I can.
Chadwick's a growing boy, I don't think it's appropriate of you to give him intoxicating libations.
And he didn't even give his momma any goodnight sugar.
It's a music box, it plays European love songs, but they're the same in any language.

[On hula round his neck]
These are not only decorative but they also keep my neck warm.
Miss Prentice, as part of the service I'll promise to get a little older every day.
Mr Gates, do you think you can satisfy a school teacher and 4 teenage girls?
Oh, I'll sure try, ma'am. I-I'll do all I can.
They taught us that corny hula stuff in dance school when I was 3.
You were never 3.
Even though there's no surf, he's right back in the swim.
Well he's about to be beached!
Are you always so bored or is it me?
Life is a bore I always say.
Oh already?
I've had 17 years of it.
That's the fun part. Wait till the next seventeen.
Don't start that child psychology bit, I'm no child.
I'm no psychologist.
What's your idea of action?
What's yours?
Ernest, counting is not cool!
You're up early this morning son.
I have to, I've got a job.
A job? Working?
You boys sing beautiful, I hope you get life with me!
My baby's home from the big house
Oh, Sarah Lee, will you forget those old movies?
Chadwick think of who you are. Remember you come from a fine family.
You'll do enough remembering for both of us, ma.
Oh Daddy, what did we do wrong?
Offhand I'd say we got married.
You ever see anything like this in a cradle?
Back to your room!
I couldn't sleep there.
Well you sure can't sleep here. Perhaps you should take a bath - on second thoughts make that a cold shower!
Well at least we have 5 minutes.
I have 5 minutes Miss over-sexed and under-aged.
Moonlight in Hawaii can be rather intoxicating.
I know, that's why I never touch the stuff.
Nobody cares about me, whether I live or die.
Nobody seems to care because you don't seem to care about yourself. You have to care first, if you like yourself others will like you too.
There's nothing to like.
There's a lot to like if you wouldn't try to be something you're not. It don't work. I know. You're gonna find out now and save yourself a lot of grieve.
Miss Prentice I'm not the guy you think I am, I snore and everything.
You're pretty sure of yourself.
Isn't it about time?

[after seeing Chad and Maile dancing to "Rock a Hula Rock"]
Daddy, I'm gonna to have a headache. A dreadful headache!
Hey, Chad, why don't you go get some firewood for dinner?
Firewood? Man you'll eat anything!
I woke up when I heard our dog barking, and I thought Chadwick was coming in then. But then I realized that it couldn't be, 'cause we don't have a dog.
What were you doing all that time while I was missing you?
Uhm, being true to you.
Always?
Almost always.
The army? Oh, that's a lovely organization.
Oh, I get along very well with teenagers. I used to be one myself.
And not too long ago.
What was that?
Something we may have to get used to, Sarah Lee. It's called the sound of youth.
Shall we start our tour with the pineapple fields?
I hate pineapples.
Well, then let's go there first and get it over with.
And what's your name, little girl?
You may call me Miss Corbett.
Who is this character anyway?
This is my boss, dad.
Your ex- you're fired young man.
Mr. Chapman, he was only protecting your clients. You can't fire him.
Oh yes I can, I'll do it again,too. Just watch me.
[turns to Chad and points a finger at him]
You're fired. You see?
Men, you can have them.
I don't want em.
Get out!
[Maile slams the door]
I want you!
Gates and Duval travel service. Has a nice ring to it.
It's too long. Simple. Gates of Hawaii.
Don't I get any billing?
Sure. Gates is plural. In case you didn't recognize it, that's a proposal. That has a better ring.
You're sure?
Well, I suppose I could be romantic about it but you'll say yes anyway.
I could try to explain what happened, Maile but nobody would believe me. Not even me. Will you just believe this- I love you and there's nothing between Miss Prentice and me.
Well of course you deny it. But I know that look and she's got it.
That look is for Jack. He's got it, too.
Mr. Kellman and Miss Prentice?
[Chad nods, smiling]
Oh, you can do better than that. You must think I'm a fool.
Oh, it's such a shame Captain Polk was a damn yankee.
She's a lovely woman, that Miss Prentice. They make a handsome couple, young Gates and Miss Prentice.
They do?
Yeah. Miss Prentice is quite taken with the boy, too. She's even extended her tour.
Now that's hanky-panky. From where I stand.
Mom, I'm sorry, honestly. But it wasn't my fault.
Oh, I know that, dear. It's your friends. Mostly that Duval girl. She's the one to blame.
Maile had nothing to do with it.
Well she was there, wasn't she? And you got that job working in her tourist place. Well, who else can we blame? She's pulling you down to her level.

[after Sarah Lee Gates fainted when her husband told her that Chad is going to get married over the phone]
Everything okay, Mr. Gates. Missie Gates just taking nap, s'il vous plaît.
